alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 06 at 11:32AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, South Central Mountains. In north central New Mexico, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Jemez Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered-to-numerous and slow moving thunderstorms are expected to develop on the higher terrain today. Locally heavy rain is expected with rain rates reaching over 1 inch per hour in the strongest cells. The risk for flash flooding will be especially high within and below recent wildfire burn scars, including the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon, Cerro Pelado and McBride burn scars. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
